name: Gramercy Tavern's Expat
description: Sometimes on a cold fall evening all you want to drink is a bright, sunny cocktail to remind of warmer days recently passed. This Gramercy Tavern creation draws inspiration from both the classic Hemingway Daiquiri and Audrey Saunders' Old Cuban. It's at once tart and refreshing with a touch of richness from the golden rum.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces aged rum, such as Banks "7 Golden Age" rum
1/4 ounce fresh juice from about 2 limes

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the rum, maraschino, lime juice, simple syrup, and bitters. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
